etymology.description: 信 (trust; faith) + 义/義 (righteousness; justice) = integrity, good faith and honor.
etymology.interpretation: Emphasizes keeping one’s word while acting in accordance with moral righteousness. Common in Confucian ethics, personal conduct, and business dealings.
etymology.simplification: 義 was simplified to 义 by reducing strokes and streamlining the form; 信 is unchanged. The reform preserved the core meaning while making writing faster.

examples.chinese: 他很讲信义(他很講信義)。
examples.english: He values good faith and honor.

examples.chinese: 朋友之间要以信义相交(朋友之間要以信義相交)。
examples.pinyin: Péngyǒu zhījiān yào yǐ xìnyì xiāngjiāo.
examples.english: Friends should associate with each other in good faith.

examples.chinese: 在商业往来中(在商業往來中)，双方须以信义为本(雙方須以信義為本)。
examples.pinyin: Zài shāngyè wǎnglái zhōng, shuāngfāng xū yǐ xìnyì wéi běn.
examples.english: In business dealings, both parties must take good faith as fundamental.
